Name.label: Partial duplication of the long arm of chromosome 14

TextSection.Contents: 14q32 duplication syndrome is a rare chromosomal anomaly syndrome resulting from the partial duplication of the long arm of chromosome 14 that results in a predisposition to a number of adult-onset myeloproliferative neoplasms, including acute myeloid leukemia, chronic myelomonocytic leukemia, and myeloproliferative neoplasms, especially essential thrombocythemia. Progression to myelofibrosis and secondary acute myeloid leukemia can be observed.

Name.label: E (exact mapping (the terms and the concepts are equivalent))

Synonym.label: Predisposition to adult-onset myeloproliferative neoplasm due to 14q32 duplication
